event.title: bloomed with the opening of the Erie Canal in 1825

data.event: The village bloomed with the opening of the Erie Canal in 1825.
Jordan became an incorporated village in 1835.

event.title: 1983, much of the village was included

data.event: In 1983, much of the village was included in the Jordan Village Historic District and listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

event.title: April 25, 1865, Abraham Lincoln's black-draped funeral train slowed

data.event: On April 25, 1865, Abraham Lincoln's black-draped funeral train slowed for the crowd lining the New York Central Railroad tracks at the Erie Canal on the way west to Springfield, Illinois.
The tree, which was cut down in the 1930s, was referred to as the "cannonball tree" although no one knew the tale was true until the tree was chopped down and "there it was."
